proportionate.value: adj. 成比例的；相称的：being in due proportion; proportional

propriety.value: n. 适当；正当；得体：the quality of being proper; appropriateness

prospect.value:
n. 成功机会，前景，前途：chances; financial expectations, especially of success
n. 预期；展望：something expected; a possibility

prosper.value:
v. 繁荣， 昌盛：to be fortunate or successful, especially in terms of one's finances; thrive
【派】prosperity   adj. 繁荣；兴旺；富足

protean.value:
adj. 多变的；变化多端的：readily taking on varied shapes, forms, or meanings
adj. 各种各样的，多才多艺的：displaying great diversity or variety : versatile

providential.value:
adj. 幸运的，正合时宜的；及时的：opportune; lucky; happening at exactly the right time
【派】providentially   adv.凑巧地

proximity.value: n. 接近，亲近：the state, quality, sense, or fact of being near or next; closeness

prudent.value: adj. 审慎的；慎重的：careful about one's conduct; circumspect

pseudonym.value: n. 假名：a fictitious name assumed by an author; a pen name

puerile.value: adj. 不成熟的，孩子气的：immature; childish

quaint.value:
adj. 古怪的：unusual or different in character or appearance: odd 
adj. 奇特的；古色古香的；古雅的：pleasingly or strikingly old-fashioned or unfamiliar

quantitative.value: adj. 数量的：of, relating to, or expressible in terms of a specified or indefinite number or amount

quash.value: v. 镇压，平息：to put down or suppress forcibly and completely

quell.value:
v. 用武力平息，镇压：to put down forcibly; suppress
【考】quell

querulous.value: adj. 表示埋怨或不平的，发牢骚的：expressing a complaint or grievance; grumbling

quibble.value:
v. 吹毛求疵：to find fault or criticize for petty reasons; cavil
【派】quibbler  n.吹毛求疵的人
【考】quibbler

quiescent.value:
adj. 沉寂的；静态的；不活动的：marked by inactivity or repose: tranquilly at rest 
【派】quiescence   n. 沉寂；安静；不活动   quiescency   n. 静止，沉寂
【考】quiescence

quotidian.value:
adj. 日常的，每天的：belonging to each day : everyday 
adj. 普通的；寻常的：commonplace, ordinary

radical.value:
adj. 根本的；基本的；彻底的：arising from or going to a root or source; basic
adj. 极端的，彻底的：departing markedly from the usual or customary; extreme
adj. 激进的；激进派的：favoring or effecting fundamental or revolutionary changes in current practices, conditions, or institutions
【派】radicalism   n. 激进主义

rage.value:
v. 狂怒地说，狂怒地做：to speak or act in violent anger
v. 盛行，肆虐：to spread or prevail forcefully
n. 狂怒；盛怒：violent, explosive anger
【考】raging

rally.value:
n. 集合：a gathering, especially one intended to inspire enthusiasm for a cause
【考】rallying

ramification.value:
n. 分枝：a subordinate part extending from a main body; a branch
n. （决定、计划、事件产生的）后果，影响：a development or consequence growing out of and sometimes complicating a problem, plan, or statement
【注】在填空中该词一般表示的是结果或者影响如：legal/political/economic etc ramifications。在阅读中，该词经常等于implication，也是possible effect/result的意思。如该句：The Kamioka findings have potentially far-reaching ramifications.

rampant.value: adj. 猖獗的，不受限制地蔓延的：extending unchecked; unrestrained

rant.value: v. 咆哮；大喊大叫；夸夸其谈：to speak or declaim in a violent, loud, or vehement manner; rave

reassess.value:
v. 重新考虑；再次决定；再次评价：to think about something again carefully in order to decide whether to change your opinion or judgment about it
【派】reassessment  n. 重新斟酌，重新考虑；重新估价

rebuff.value: v. 拒绝；回绝：to reject bluntly, often disdainfully; snub

recant.value: v. 撤回声明；放弃信仰：to withdraw or repudiate (a statement or belief) formally and publicly : renounce

receptive.value: adj. 乐于接受的，能接纳的：ready or willing to receive favorably

recipe.value:
n. 诀窍；方法：a formula for or means to a desired end
n. 原因： if you say that something is a recipe for a particular situation, you mean that it is likely to result in that situation
【注】考生要注意该词的释义还有：处方，医疗处方：a medical prescription

reciprocity.value: n. 互惠；互换：a mutual or cooperative interchange of favors or privileges

recoil.value: v. 退缩；后退：to shrink back, as in fear or repugnance

recondite.value: adj. 深奥的，艰涩的，艰深的：concerned with or treating something abstruse or obscure

recount.value: v. 讲述；描述；描绘：to relate in detail : narrate

redeem.value:
v. 弥补：to make up for
v. 挽回（声誉）：to restore the honor, worth, or reputation of
【派】redemption   n. 赎回；偿还；拯救；救赎
      redemptive   adj. 赎回的；拯救的
【注】考生要注意短语：beyond redemption 无可挽救的；不可救药的。例如：I have no doubt that we are polluting the environment beyond redemption. 我丝毫都不怀疑我们对环境的污染是不可挽回的。
【考】redeemed

redouble.value:
v. 加倍；加强：to make twice as great in size or amount broadly : intensify, strengthen 
【考】redoubles

redress.value:
v. 矫正；纠正；改正：to set right; remedy or rectify
v. 调整；调节：to adjust (a balance, for example)

refine.value:
v. 使高雅：to free from coarse, unsuitable, or immoral characteristics
v. 改进，改善，精炼：to improve or perfect by pruning or polishing 
v. 提炼，精炼：to reduce to a pure state; purify
【考】refined

refuge.value: n. 庇护所；避难所；安全地带：a place providing protection or shelter

rehabilitate.value:
v. 康复，恢复：to restore to a former capacity: reinstate
v. 恢复名誉：to restore to good repute : reestablish the good name of

rein.value:
v. 制止，抑制：to check or stop by or as if by a pull at the reins
n. 支配权，控制权：controlling or guiding power

rejuvenate.value:
v. 使恢复青春；使恢复活力： to make young or youthful again: give new vigor to 
v. 更新；恢复原先的状态：to restore to an original or new condition

rekindle.value:
v. 重新点燃；使重新活跃： if something rekindles an interest, feeling, or thought that you used to have, it makes you think about it or feel it again
v. 再次引起，再次引发（使人不悦的状况）： if something rekindles an unpleasant situation, it makes the unpleasant situation happen again

relevance.value: n. 相关性：pertinence to the matter at hand

relinquish.value:
v. 放弃，出让（权力或控制）：give up; to give over possession or control of : yield
【派】relinquishment    n. 放弃
【考】relinquished

relish.value:
v. 欣赏；品味：to take keen or zestful pleasure in
【考】relished

reluctant.value:
adj.  不情愿的，厌恶的， 勉强的：feeling or showing aversion, hesitation, or unwillingness
【注】该官方真题例句中credit为荣誉，赞美的意思，extend意为：提出to make the offer of : proffer; to make available 例如：extending credit to customers贷款给顾客

remuneration.value:
n. 酬报，酬劳：something, such as a payment, that remunerates
【注】注意动词形式：remunerate    v. 给…报酬

render.value:
v. 给予；提供：to give or make available; provide
v. 致使；造成：to cause to be or become : make
v. 表演；演奏；扮演：to give a performance
v. 执行：to direct the execution of : administer
v. 描述，描写：to represent in verbal form; depict
v. 表示；致以：to give what is due or owed
【注】render还有一个释义为：放弃，投降 give up, yield; 其同根词：surrender v. 投降屈服；放弃

renounce.value:
v. 宣布放弃：to give up, refuse, or resign usually by formal declaration
v. 正式放弃（要求、官阶或头衔）：to give up (a title, for example), especially by formal announcement
v. 拒绝承认，拒绝遵从，拒绝接受：to refuse to follow, obey, or recognize any further : repudiate
【注】nounce=speak, 表示“讲话，说出” 同根词如下：
pronounced  adj. 明显的
announcement  n. 布告，通告；声明，预告
pronunciation  n. 发音，发音方法
denunciate  v. 公开指责，公然抨击，谴责
renounce  v. 否认，宣布放弃，抛弃
denounce  v. 公开指责，公然抨击；谴责

repress.value:
v. 压制，压抑，克制：to hold back by an act of volition

repugnance.value: n.  厌恶，反感：strong dislike, distaste, or antagonism

requisite.value:
adj. 必需的；必备的；必不可少的：required; essential
adj. 必需品；必备品；必要条件：something that is indispensable; a requirement

resent.value:

resurge.value:

retain.value: v. 保持，保留：to keep or hold in a particular place, condition, or position

retreat.value: n. 后退；撤退：the act or process of withdrawing, especially from something hazardous, formidable, or unpleasant

rife.value: adj. 普遍的，盛行的，常见的（常与with使用）：copiously supplied : abounding；abundant or numerous

n. 典礼；(宗教)仪式：the prescribed form of conducting a formal secular ceremony

rueful.value:
adj. 后悔的，懊悔的，遗憾的：causing, feeling, or expressing sorrow or regret

ruthless.value: adj. 无情的，残忍的，冷酷的：having no compassion or pity; merciless

scuffle.value: v. 混战，扭打：to fight or struggle confusedly at close quarters

n. 虚伪；虚假，赝品：something false or empty that is purported to be genuine; a spurious imitation

share.value:

shift.value:
v. 转移，挪动：to move or transfer from one place or position to another
v.  (意见、情况、政策)有所变动，稍作改变：if someone's opinion, a situation, or a policy shifts or is shifted, it changes slightly

adj. 目光短浅的；无远见的：lacking foresight

shrewd.value:
adj. 精明的，机灵的：characterized by keen awareness, sharp intelligence, and often a sense of the practical

v. 表示出不情愿；犹豫：to show reluctance; hesitate

adj. 易激动的，易受惊的：restlessly active or nervous; restive
adj. 易变的，善变的：undependably variable; mercurial or fickle
adj. 谨慎的，警惕的：marked by extreme caution : wary

slippery.value: adj. 狡猾的，不可信的：not trustworthy; elusive or tricky

sloth.value:

v. 脱衣服：to undress completely

n. 调查，研究：a detailed inspection or investigation

【考】surveying

sustained.value: adj. 持久的，持续的：continuing for a long time

sycophant.value: n. 马屁精，阿谀奉承的人：a servile self-seeker who attempts to win favor by flattering influential people

symmetry.value:
n.（形状、设计或结构的）对称，匀称：something that has symmetry is symmetrical in shape, design, or structure
n. （数量的）相等，相当：symmetry in a relationship or agreement is the fact of both sides giving and receiving an equal amount

sympathetic.value:
adj. 赞同的，支持的：favorably inclined : approving
adj. 同情的，表示同情的：given to, marked by, or arising from sympathy, compassion, friendliness, and sensitivity to others' emotions
【派】sympathetically  adv. 同情地；赞同地
【注】考生要注意sympathetically在真题中表示赞同的考法，例如：The characterization of historical analysis as a form of fiction is not likely to be received sympathetically by either historians or literary critics, who agree that history and fiction deal with distinct orders of experience. 把历史分析描述为小说的形式既不太可能被历史学家所赞同，也不可能被文学评论家所认同，他们认为历史和小说处理不同类型的经历。
同时注意该官方真题例句中，order为种类，类型的意思。而，在否定句中，either意思为：两者都（不），既（不）；例如：music that fails to be either funny or funky既无趣又没有强烈节奏的音乐

synthesize.value:
v. 综合，融合：to combine so as to form a new, complex product
v. （通过化学或生物反应）合成：to form or produce by means of chemical or biological reactions
【考】synthesizing

temperance.value: n. 节制；有分寸；自我克制：moderation and self-restraint, as in behavior or expression

terrific.value:
adj. 极好的；非常棒的；了不起的：very good or fine; splendid
adj. 非常厉害的，可怕的：very bad or unpleasant; frightful
adj. 可怕的，恐怖的：causing terror or great fear; terrifying

thrift.value: n. 节俭，节约：wise economy in the management of money and other resources; frugality

thrilled.value: adj. 欣喜若狂的；非常开心的：extremely pleased about something

thrive.value: v. 繁荣：to make steady progress; prosper

throwback.value: n. 复古；回归：a reversion to a former type or ancestral characteristic

thwart.value: v. 使受挫；阻碍；阻挠：to prevent the occurrence, realization, or attainment of

timid.value:
adj. 胆小的；害羞的；缺乏自信的：lacking self-confidence; shy
adj. 胆怯的，犹豫不决的：fearful and hesitant
【考】timidity

toll.value:
v. 收费：to charge a fee for using (a structure, such as a bridge)
n. (桥梁、道路的)通行费：a fixed charge or tax for a privilege, especially for passage across a bridge or along a road
【注】注意短语：
❶ exact a toll  对…有害；使…付出代价，例如：the strain of a violent ground campaign will exact a toll on troops. 激烈的地面战役带来的紧张压力将让军队付出代价。
❷ takes its toll / takes a heavy toll造成恶果(或不利影响、痛苦等)：if you say that something takes its toll or takes a heavy toll, you mean that it has a bad effect or causes a lot of suffering.例如：a high exchange rate took a heavy toll on industry. 高汇率使工业蒙受了严重损失。

tortuous.value:
adj. 曲折的：having or marked by repeated turns or bends; winding or twisting
adj. 诡计多端的，曲折的：marked by devious or indirect tactics: crooked, tricky
adj. 复杂的，冗长复杂的：highly involved; complex; circuitous, involved

totality.value: n. 全体;整个;全部：the quality or state of being total

trample.value:
v. 严厉或无情地对待：to treat harshly or ruthlessly
v. 践踏；无视；伤害：to inflict injury or destruction especially contemptuously or ruthlessly

transcend.value:
v. 超出…的限度：to pass beyond the limits of
v. 超越，胜过：to be greater than, as in intensity or power; surpass

transcribe.value:

transform.value:

adj. 奸诈的；背信弃义的；不可信任的：marked by betrayal of fidelity, confidence, or trust; perfidious
adj. 危险的；变化无常的：marked by unforeseen hazards; dangerous or deceptive

adj. 混乱的，动荡的：full of activity, confusion, or violence

uncanny.value: adj. 奇怪的；离奇的；费解的：peculiarly unsettling, as if of supernatural origin or nature; eerie

adj. 潜在的：present but not obvious; implicit
adj. 基础的，基本的，根本的：basic; fundamental

undermine.value: v. 削弱，损害：to weaken, injure, or impair, often by degrees or imperceptibly; sap

underplay.value: v. 轻描淡写；贬低；淡化…的重要性：to present or deal with subtly or with restraint; play down
